intro: Diphyllocalyx cayensis, commonly known as the Cayenne starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit, which resembles a starfruit, is edible and has a crisp, tangy flavor. The plant is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
